channel.title: Item id's
channel.description:
Hello.. I'm quite new to botting and stuff.. I've been scripting but i'm going one step further.
I've been messing around with GLIntercept etc. But how will i get NPC id's with it etc? Any tips?

item.title: Item id's
item.dc:creator: @darkfigter22 darkfigter22
item.description:
@darkfigter22 wrote:

Pwnd:

I WANT TO MAKE A BOT BUT HAVE NO IDEA WHAT IM DOING. STARTING OUT BY ACTUALLY LEARNING THE APIS I WILL BE USING DOES NOT MAKE SENSE. CAN YOU JUST TELL ME INSTEAD?

I do not want to make a bot, get your facts straight.

item.title: Item id's
item.dc:creator: @darkfigter22 darkfigter22
item.description:
@darkfigter22 wrote:

[quote=“veer, post:13, topic:442055”]The GL coordinates are inside your 3D model space, however on screen they undergo a perspective projection transform. You need to undo this, and on Windows you can via GLUT gluUnProject():
http://nehe.gamedev.net/article/using_gluunproject/16013/[/quote]

Okay but what information would i need out of that model? I mean like what are the vertex x,y?
I need basics xD

Read full topic

item.title: Item id's
item.dc:creator: @slavemaster veer
item.description:
@slavemaster wrote:

The GL coordinates are inside your 3D model space, however on screen they undergo a perspective projection transform. You need to undo this, and on Windows you can via GLUT gluUnProject():
http://nehe.gamedev.net/article/using_gluunproject/16013/

Read full topic

glVertexPointer(3,GL_FLOAT,24,00000000)

and what will i need out of that coord to convert it?

Read full topic

item.title: Item id's
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

You are going to want to learn about converting the GL coord to an onscreen coord, I remember reading something about it once by NeHe but I really do not remember the website and google is censored today so you will have to look it up yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Item id's
item.dc:creator: @darkfigter22 darkfigter22
item.description:
@darkfigter22 wrote:

Okay i see… out of this i would be able to get the ID.
But how can i know the coords of this model?

glGenBuffersARB(1,0D731264)
glBindBufferARB(GL_ARRAY_BUFFER,494)
glBufferDataARB(GL_ARRAY_BUFFER,7920,04EA9884,GL_STATIC_DRAW)
glBindBufferARB(GL_ARRAY_BUFFER,492)
glVertexPointer(3,GL_FLOAT,24,00000000)
glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY)
glBindBufferARB(GL_ARRAY_BUFFER,494)
glNormalPointer(GL_FLOAT,12,00000000)
glEnableClientState(GL_NORMAL_ARRAY)
glBindBufferARB(GL_ARRAY_BUFFER,463)
glColorPointer(4,GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE,36,0000000C)
glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY)
glTexCoordPointer(2,GL_FLOAT,36,0000001C)
glEnableClientState(GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY)
glBindTexture(GL_TEXTURE_2D,129)
glDrawElements(GL_TRIANGLES,96,GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT,00000000) Textures[ (0,11) (0,129) (0,121) (0,6) (0,10) (1,12) (1,9) (2,1) ]
glBindTexture(GL_TEXTURE_2D,130)
glDrawElements(GL_TRIANGLES,912,GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT,000000C0) Textures[ (0,11) (0,130) (0,121) (0,6) (0,10) (1,12) (1,9) (2,1) ]
glPopMatrix()
glLightfv(GL_LIGHT2,GL_POSITION,0DD02D7C)
glLightfv(GL_LIGHT2,GL_DIFFUSE,0DD02D7C)
glLightf(GL_LIGHT2,GL_QUADRATIC_ATTENUATION,0.000002)
glEnable(GL_LIGHT2)
glDisable(GL_LIGHT3)
glDisable(GL_LIGHT4)
glPushMatrix()
glMultMatrixf([1.000000,0.000000,0.000000,0.000000,0.000000,1.000000,0.000000,0.000000,0.000000,0.000000,1.000000,0.000000,27392.000000,-2784.000000,24832.000000,1.000000])

Read full topic

item.title: Item id's
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

From mopman_sucks:

[code]DWORD QuickChecksum(DWORD *pData, int size)
{
if(!pData) { return 0x0; }

DWORD sum;
DWORD tmp;
sum = *pData;

for(int i = 1; i < (size/4); i++)
{
	tmp = pData[i];
	tmp = (DWORD)(sum >> 29) + tmp;
	tmp = (DWORD)(sum >> 17) + tmp;
	sum = (DWORD)(sum << 3)  ^ tmp;
}

return sum;

}
[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Item id's
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

to create an identification system with openGL you will need to write your own system as no database exists with model checksums.

Read full topic

item.title: Item id's
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

it does not “give you ids” you can’t do that with open GL however id does create a checksum for models.

Read full topic

As for specific code, I can not help you there. Definitely not qualified
